perturbation.original_text: The undersigned understands and agrees that as to          ----------------                                                     GSMS he is an "affiliate" under Rule 145(c) as defined in Rule 405 of the Rules and Regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC") under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended ("1933 Act"), and the undersigned anticipates that he will be such an "affiliate" at the time of the Merger.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned understands and agrees that as to GSMS he *may be considered* an "affiliate" under Rule 145(c) as defined in Rule 405 of the Rules and Regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC") under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended ("1933 Act"), and the undersigned anticipates that he will *not necessarily* be such an "affiliate" at the time of the Merger.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states the undersigned *is* an affiliate and *will be* at the time of the Merger. The modified text uses "may be considered" and "not necessarily," introducing uncertainty about the affiliate status, thus creating a contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: The undersigned agrees that he          ----------------------------------                                  will not sell, transfer, or otherwise dispose of his interests in, or reduce his risk relative to, any of the shares of PSS Common Stock into which his shares of GSMS Common Stock are converted upon consummation of the Merger until such time as PSS notifies the undersigned that the requirements of SEC Accounting Series Release Nos. 130 and 135 ("ASR 130 and 135") have been met. The undersigned understands that ASR 130 and 135 relate to publication of financial results of post-Merger combined operations of PSS and GSMS. PSS agrees that it will publish such results as promptly as practicable following the Merger in the sole discretion of PSS, but in any event within 45 days after the end of the first fiscal quarter of PSS containing the required period of post-Merger combined operations and that it will notify the undersigned promptly following such publication.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned agrees that he will not sell, transfer, or otherwise dispose of his interests in, or reduce his risk relative to, any of the shares of PSS Common Stock into which his shares of GSMS Common Stock are converted upon consummation of the Merger *unless* PSS authorizes such action. The undersigned understands that ASR 130 and 135 relate to publication of financial results of post-Merger combined operations of PSS and GSMS. PSS *does not guarantee* that it will publish such results as promptly as practicable following the Merger; *the publication and timing are solely at the discretion of PSS*. PSS will *endeavor* to notify the undersigned following such publication, *if any*.
perturbation.explanation: The original text restricts disposition until ASR 130/135 requirements are met, while the modified version allows for disposition with PSS authorization, contradicting the initial restriction. Also, the original guarantees publication within a specific timeframe; the modified version removes this guarantee, making it discretionary and uncertain.

perturbation.original_text: PSS agrees, for a period of three years          ------------------------                                           after the effective date of the Merger, to file on a timely basis all reports required to be filed by it pursuant to Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, so that the public information provisions of Rule 145(d) promulgated by the SEC as the same are presently in effect will be available to the undersigned in the event the undersigned desires to transfer any shares of PSS Common Stock issued to the undersigned pursuant to the Merger.
perturbation.changed_text: PSS *may, at its sole discretion*, file reports pursuant to Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. *The filing of these reports, and their timeliness, is not guaranteed and is subject to PSS's business needs and legal counsel's advice*. The availability of public information provisions of Rule 145(d) to the undersigned in the event of a desire to transfer shares *is not guaranteed*.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states PSS *agrees* to file reports for three years, providing access to public information. The modified text changes this to a discretionary action by PSS, removing the guarantee of filing and creating uncertainty about the availability of information needed for share transfers, directly contradicting the initial commitment.
